It was a good place. Easy to find and comfortable. Very clean. Overall a great stay.
The only problem was that we were charged $85 for a cleaning fee but then asked to do a bunch of chores on the way out. Paying $85 for cleaning for a
one night is annoying, but it's not the end of the world. But if we pay that, we shouldn't have to be the ones to strip the beds. What was the 85 dollar fee for?
Overall, pretty good place. One annoying thing but it was still a good stay.

name: Brian
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
December 2021
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Notes for other guests: the house is located on the west side of m35 and is situated directly next to the highway, which the photos in the listing don’t make clear. (It is also correct that google maps will absolutely send you to the wrong location). Host also requires you to put your bedding in a hamper and to remove trash bags upon checkout despite having a cleaning crew. Host also requests you to leave the key on table and door unlocked upon checkout, which I personally find to be a risk for any guests if something were to happen in the in-between time and the guest gets blamed for it (I also think just one key is a bit inconvenient for multiple guests and that a key code system would be better anyway). The furnace that warms the place up is very loud and may affect your sleep, and the house cools quickly, causing the furnace to kick on frequently (which also reheats quickly, however). The furniture, furnishings, media set up, bathroom, and decor are very mediocre. (Just as an example, the queen bed in one of the rooms was on a slant and gives you the feeling that you’re falling off of it). I think the place needs to be updated in many ways. These things may not bother most, but I felt the need to mention them for those whom it may bother. (A side note: my cell phone, which uses the T-Mobile network, didn’t always have service at this location). The thing that may bother most, however, is that the entire place also has a very, very strong mildew smell, so much so that one can even smell it from outside if the front door is open.
On the positive side, Russell communicates well and is very accommodating if you have any needs. The living room was spacious and had plenty of seating. I give it 3/5 (although other guests in my party would have given it less and would not stay again).

Stayed with kids
review_text: This is a clean, nice roof-over-the-head site near the heart of town. A little pricey for what it is, but the host does describe everything in detail, so shame on us if we miss it (I missed that there's no access to the lake across the street, and someone else apparently missed the cleaning fee). The host is right, won't find the place using a GPS (Google Maps, Wayz, etc) and I made the mistake of thinking there must be more than one Airport in this lil U.P. town when I passed "Delta County Airport" and continued looking for "Escanaba Airport"... oops. Not far from the local beaches, I'd recommend Ludington Park. I stopped and grabbed some beer from Upper Hand Brewing, hidden behind the Airport, and we ate a few miles away at Freshwater Tavern. My son and I also had a nice night by the fire put. He keeps a stock of firewood, the yard is nice enough, and you can still see the lake across the road.

review_text: My boyfriend and I stayed here at the end of a week long road trip, mainly camping, around the UP. It is a bit on the pricier side for just two people, but since we booked out only a month prior on Labor Day weekend, it was the only reasonable place we could find in the area. It was a clean and cozy place to recharge, shower, and sleep in a comfortable bed after days of camping. I think this would be ideal for a group of people looking for a home base for a week/weekend of fishing. Very close to boat ramp access at the river mouth, Upper Hand brewery, and bars/restaurants in town.

This would be a great spot for a few couples or for a family with kids. It’s close to grocery stores, some chain restaurants, and a few pasty shops. We took several day trips— Iron Mountain, Pictured Rocks, etc. and the drives were not bad.

name: Anthony
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2022
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
Great little clean & classy Airbnb in a good location, right downtown Escanaba. Definitely worth the trip and price! I'm so glad I stayed here instead of a local hotel, especially after reading some of the reviews lol. It has everything you need, the hosts are great people and very accommodating. Not to mention walking distance to the local businesses and also a chocolate/candy shop? right next door in the same hallway as the Airbnb with great chocolate covered oreos. I give it 5 stars.
The only negative things I could say is the seagulls seemed to be having a little party during my stay in the AM., squawking it up outside lmao!
The police are all over that main street pulling everybody over for the stupidest reasons all hours of the day, flat out harassing people and also hiding & waiting for them to leave the local bars on that street then pulling them over... That's clearly harassment... but hey who knows what goes on around there?
I still give it five stars because the negatives are out of the Airbnb hosts control and it is a great place and location to stay regardless! If you're not a drunk driver and don't mind a little potential seagull action in the a.m., your good to go!

I worked for three days during my stay and I am on Zoom video meetings for 8+ hours a day and I had no problems with the Wifi connection, which means I was able to stay connected all day long with no dropped meetings.

Escanaba is a decent launching point for UP adventures if staying for more than a couple of days.

The surroundings are beautiful (across the street from Little Bay De Noc, Ludington Park and hotel, and great walk to Sand Point Lighthouse and boat docks), and it's only a 10-15 min walk to the beach areas. Plenty of restaurants down Ludington St, and plenty of areas to explore. I'll stay here again in a heartbeat.

name: Mary
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a charming, nicely remodeled small older home in a historic district of Escanaba, right near the marina and Ludington Park. Quick walk into the downtown district, shops and restaurants, and easy walk or bike to beaches. There are lake views from the Living Room and the yard! Nice neighborhood to walk around, also. The house is very comfortable, has all that I needed and just as described. Kate was very helpful and accommodating throughout the process. Parking is easy on the street or on their grass area off their alley-way. Lots of thoughtful provisions (beach towels, beach chairs) and the kitchen is well supplied with plenty of dishes. Nice bathroom and comfortable (albeit cozy!) bedroom. Bring your own bath soap/gel. A very good stay and would highly recommend for a couple, a small family (there's a pull-out couch also) and might work for two very friendly couples also. I was here for work so didn't get to see as much of the area as I would have liked, but lots!

Kitchen well stocked, comfortable bed and furniture. Loved sitting outside to eat.
Definitely recommend staying here.

The next door neighbor was quite friendly and helpful. House has just been renovated/redecorated. Beautiful flooring, new Anderson windows, fixtures in kitchen and bath look new, nicely decorated, comfortable furniture. Great view from living room picture windows of the bay. Escanaba is a small town, so house is not far from anything. Waterfront and park are walking distance. (Most guests would want/need a vehicle for going to restaurants.). Hosts have put a lot of thought into helpful, small kitchen items, such as the toaster oven and blender. Also, hosts provide beach towels and a large new washer & dryer. We would definitely stay here again.

review_text: Great location. Love the downtown feel. We hit up many local places like stone cup coffee house for coffee, MO’s for pizza and beer, Upper Hand brewery for handcrafted beer, and Hereford and Hops for a steak and fish fry. The location was quiet, clean, and just what we needed. Escanaba was also a great place to stay if you plan to explore more of the U.P like we did. We chased waterfalls (Au Train was the most beautiful), went to Kitch-lti-kipi, and Feyette Historic park. What a wonderful stay for our 9 year wedding anniversary. 🫶

We were very pleased with the location and the accommodations. Absolutely perfect for a couple! The convenience of stores and restaurants nearby were an added bonus ⭐️
On that note The Family Inn restaurant had the most friendly wait staff and the food was delish with generous helpings and very affordable in comparison to others in the area. 🌮 Great Shrimp Tacos!!
Before booking our stay here I had read a comment about hallway traffic up & down the stairs. Yes, there is quite a bit of foot traffic although it did not whatsoever interfere with our stay. Met all our needs.
We would highly recommend choosing this Airbnb if visiting Escanaba ⭐️

name: Jennie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Fantastic value for a clean, comfortable single or couple stay in Esky! The kitchen was equipped with everything needed to prepare meals -- all sizes pots and pans, baking trays and dishes, mixing bowls, measuring glass, cups, and spoons -- and all the linens and oven gloves, too. Comfy couch and bed. Everything was nice and clean. The shower stall was on the small size, so do prepare for that if you're a bit tall or wide. Fantastic location, with so many diners and restaurants downtown (a block from Mueller's Pizza, a particular favorite of mine since childhood). I thought I'd hear a lot of noise from the busy intersection, but the walls are thick and the windows must be great, because it didn't bother me. There was quite a bit of foot traffic on the stairs to the upper apartments, both night and day; if you're a light sleeper, you may want to plan with some earplugs or noise cancelling (I found a phone app did the trick just fine).

THis is a lovely little place. It's an odd location but that's the nature of Escanaba. Everything seems to be on the main street and the highly running north of the town. The beautiful parts are all residential.
If you're an early riser, the place is fine. Because it's next to the stairway, you hear everyone coming down the stairs who are leaving at an early hour. And you're right at street level so there is some traffic but that's minimal at least when I was there.
But you can't beat the price and again the little place is very cozy.

Stayed over a week
review_text: What a great stay! My wife and I were pleased with everything. During this time of virus restrictions we wanted a place where we could prepare meals and eat in comfort, but still be in a great location for shopping, visiting the local tourist places, and especially be within easy driving distance of the state parks in the area. The cupboards were full of all the dishes, pots, pans and silverware that we needed to prepare food and eat in comfort, even luxury. The apartment was clean, tidy and well apportioned. Response to questions via text messages came within minutes. We felt free to come and go as we pleased and felt that our gear was secure in the apartment as we went out for day trips. We stayed for almost two weeks and when we left we felt as though we were leaving a place we had come to think of as home.

name: Sophie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This stay was nothing short of amazing. I have soooooo much to say, but I’ll keep this review brief! I was in contact with the hosts from the very beginning, and they were extremely responsive from day one. They even provide a number for you to call/text when you have an issue. I texted them late Saturday evening about something that was not urgent and they still got back to me. The place is exactly as you see in the pictures and more. They are fully stocked with all the kitchen items you may need (even a grater and veggie peeler)! We were allowed access to everything in there, and clean up after was minimal. Sheets and towels were clean, and the whole unit was sparkling. I loved the bed so much I asked for details on the mattress. I had two awesome nights of rest! We got great local suggestions, and they provided magazines that helped us find a couple more activities. You stay right in the heart of downtown, super close to the water, parks, art gallery, and popular spots in town. The unit is literally on the street and the walls are fairly thin. However, at no point did we feel unsafe, and we were the only ones located where we were on the first floor. Getting in was very easy, instructions were clear, and check out was a breeze. 5/5 stay. Would definitely recommend, would absolutely stay again.

Stayed over a week
review_text: We had a terrific month long stay with Tony! We went up for easier access to snowmobiling, but that didn’t pan out with Mother Nature this year. Location was great for working remotely - great WiFi connection and having the extra bedrooms were perfect for office space. Meijer is 8 minutes away and it was super handy being close to town since we were there for an extended trip. At the same time, Tony’s place felt so private and calm even though it was only a few minutes away. Snowmobiling-wise, we trailered to the trailhead about 15 mins away and had easy access to the Bay de Noc grooming club trails - which are likely well-maintained when we have actual snow! With Tony and the pups living upstairs, we were definitely expecting that it may be noisy - I can happily report that any noises were much less noticeable than in our own home with no upstairs tenants. Props to a well-built home and respectful host!! We will hopefully be back next winter, with more snow! 🤞🏼

Gas grill with propane tank. ☆☆☆☆☆ Parking was plentiful! Fenced in backyard is much appreciated. We didnt bring pets this time but you had dog beds, treats and even bowls ready for their use. Top Notch Host !

review_text: This was our second time visiting Tony’s place- this time with my husband and goldendoodle also in tow! My husband loved reading about the history of the place’s decor, and our toddler and furbaby really enjoyed playing outside in the fenced-in backyard. Tony’s place is a very short drive down the road from The Freshwater Tavern- know for its delicious food and breathtaking view. A drive through Bigby is also right down the road. Tony provides a fridge and freezer full of breakfast items which made mornings a breeze. He is proactive in messaging a few days prior, and always available by phone for questions or problems if they arise. We look forward to staying at Tony’s place again hopefully in the spring!

Very friendly and accomodating. Tony seriously thought of everything. I forgot to pack my reading glasses - he had a couple of extras. Fully stocked kitchen - clean and comfortable home. And " pet friendly " means just that. We've stayed at a couple places in the past where that was just a label until the barking started. But our three little monsters were safe and comfortable here. Although they were over stimulated and a little loud at times, Tony and his next door neighbor were really okay with it and set us at ease - which made the trip all the more relaxing.
Very easy host to work with. Had a couple of concerns on our first night - he got right back to us with an answer.
Awesome view of the lake. I understand there are some amazing sunrise views from the deck - sadly the weather didn't cooperate with us this time around. We'll definitely be planning another visit in the future.

Anything you would want, including coffee, juice, milk, eggs, breads, cereals and more! We really appreciated this after a long day of driving. It was also interesting to read where many pieces of the furnishings came from. Be sure to notice the beautiful dining table! The large fenced yard was great for our 2 dogs and us to enjoy. My husband especially loved sitting outside and building a fire with the provided wood. All the furniture was very comfortable. There’s a beautiful view of the lake from a patio off the main bedroom. We would definitely love to stay at Tony’s again.

i hope to come back & stay for a longer time soon!

The kitchen was FULLY stocked. The pictures you see are what you get and then some! The kids were so excited about the cereal and granola bars and we were thrilled with the fresh duck and chicken eggs.
The house was so comfortable we felt like we fit right in and when we had questions, Tony responded at record speed with helpful advice and recommendations.
Highly recommend! We've already told several people about this place and can't wait to return!

He actually picked something up for us while he was out and about!
Our favorite places that we visited were Pictured Rocks, Fayette Historic State Park, and downtown Escanaba (hit up Yao’s Spa if you’re looking for a massage)!
We will definitely be back when the weather is a little warmer. Thank you Tony!!!
Amanda, Miguel, and Emmy

We loved seeing all of the craftsmanship and special touches he made to his place. The serve yourself bed and breakfast is a unique feature- something that sets his place apart from the rest. It was spacious, affordable, and in a great location for those visiting Escanaba or surrounding areas. It was a great space for myself, my mom, and my toddler daughter. The view of the lake from the primary bedroom was gorgeous- we even watched a sunrise complete with 7 deer crossing! We hope to return in the summer when our whole family can join and we can utilize the backyard more!

Tony's house is very clean and comfortable, he is a wonderful host and his dogs are super friendly, we had fun playing with them in the backyard :-). Coffee, breakfast foods, and drinks are a wonderful touch, not found in any other Airbnb that we've stayed at. A fantastic restaurant, Freshwater Tavern, is within walking distance, we highly recommend this restaurant but beware, the servings are huge; there is also a Biggby Coffee at the same location if you're looking for a fancy coffee drink. We would definitely recommend this house when visiting the Escanaba area.

Stayed one night
review_text: Airbnb at its absolute best! I have stayed in enough Airbnbs to know that Tony raises the this experience to a new level. I'd like to say that Tony's was a home away from home, but it's not. His set up is much better than my own place! He provides snacks, adult beverages, fruit, breakfast items, juices, spices and a fridge stocked with condiments. The freezer is filled with frozen waffles and frosted mugs! My two motorcycle buddies and I enjoyed the decor and accommodations. The outside is just as impressive. Grill, patio set, corn hole game, fire pit, a fish cleaning station, guest bicycles and a deck that overlooks the lake. What else can one ask for!? Well, one thing...what's the story with the mannequin? Airbnbers, this place is top notch! You may never experience this amount of ammenities anywhere else.

The High Banks is such a beautiful and unique space to stay! Tony has put so much care into decorating the space with amazingly unique pieces and has this place STOCKED with amenities! The kitchen is full of food and utensils/cooking tools, there is some beautiful yard space with a fire pit (which we regrettably didn’t make use of this time), free laundry machines, AND in such a lovely location (all aspects we seriously appreciated after a week of camping in the cold and rain)! The “green-friendly” policy here was also seriously appreciated!
Tony is an excellent host and has really thought of everything. He is easy to get ahold of and very helpful! We are sad we could only stay one night, and definitely plan to be back!

review_text: I stayed here for a couple of weeks while visiting the upper peninsula and prepping for a backpacking trip. The area around the house is so beautiful and peaceful. You are close to many trails for hiking and biking, plus Pictured Rocks is an easy day trip away. I work remotely and the internet was always fast and reliable. The furniture was comfortable and the house held temperature well. The kitchen is well stocked with everything you need to make meals, with groceries less than 20 minutes away. If you don't feel like cooking, Escanaba is close and has plenty of restaurant options. I enjoyed the fire pit out back. All in all this was a great place to stay and I would recommend it to anyone passing through the area.

Rating, 4 stars

,

Stayed with kids
review_text:
This location had a deal so it was extremely affordable. The home is set out in the country a bit, which was very quiet and extremely peaceful.
The home was spacious, and we liked the layout.
There was a pretty strong musty smell to the home, and it wasn't as clean as I would have liked. There were many cobwebs and spiders, along with lots of hair in the bathrooms and on furniture. There were also dirty dishes in the cabinets. The living room furniture should be updated and was quite uncomfortable. The kitchen drawers practically fall out when being opened.
I did not like that the home did not have a lockbox as stated on the listing. Instead, the home was left unlocked for several hours until we arrived.
Jesse, the host, was very friendly, proactive, and easy to communicate with. The Yooper bars (chocolate) were a nice touch. Overall, we had a nice trip and even purchased wood so we could use the pit. Thanks for hosting!

name: Molly
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2022
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: From the very moment you walk in you feel welcomed. I stayed at the Ogden Manor for a little less than 2 months. Jeanne and Terry go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and like a true guest. A basket filled with treats was awaiting my arrival. They have everything you could possibly need while staying here - including some great reads, Netflix, cable, puzzles, game books, local magazines, and suggestions on great restaurants. I travel for work - I have been to many hotels or short term rentals, the thing that is always the highest on my list is cleanliness. This place is SPOTLESS!!! Like blow you out of the water clean - sparkling (literally) bathroom, floors so clean that you can slide across, sheets crisp and fresh, and not a speck of dust in the place. Thank you to Margie the FANTASTIC cleaning lady. There is a very comfy bed and two-pull out couches that turn to twin size beds. Plenty of towels/washcloths/hand towels. Extra set of fresh clean linens and extra blankets/pillows. Laundry is located in the basement and is $2/load. Jeanne and Terry introduced themselves and Jeanne gave me a tour of the other units. They have done so much work and have done a wonderful job keeping the charm and many original pieces in the home. It's super close to downtown, a great neighborhood to walk and close to Ludington Park (would be a GORGEOUS park in the summer/fall and so much to do there). I hadn't been to Escanaba prior to this and staying here definitely made me feel like I was "living here" . If I ever return I will be coming back here without a doubt. Thank you for such a wonderful stay!!!

Without a doubt we would make a return visit. Thanks Jeanne and Terry!

Jeanne and Terry stopped in as we were finding our way around to introduce themselves and showed us around. We had a parking area and entrance from the rear of the building. This was a great place to stay for a few days or longer. It was our first time in Escanaba and had a great time touring the area to celebrate our wedding anniversary. My wife and I highly recommend this property for a couple getting away.

A girlfriend and I booked one of the units for Labor Day weekend and to be honest, we were just super excited to get away and plan our first trip together in the U.P., that we didn't fully vet this place out. We thought it looked cute, the price was reasonable, and the location was nice. That said, we weren't 100% sure of what to expect of the space, because there weren't a ton of pictures in the listing. Well, let me tell you - her and I were PLEASANTLY surprised when we checked in.
As soon as we walked into our home for the weekend, we immediately got excited. It was homey, and a lot roomier than we imagined. Comfy bed and couches + a nice bathroom that's equipped with towels and toiletries. Loved the personal touches, like the handwritten note, a welcome basket of Yooper-made goodies, and even surgical gloves (who wouldn't appreciate gratis PPE in this pandemic?!?!).
We did a lot of outdoorsy stuff throughout our stay, and coming back to the Airbnb felt like a nice warm hug perfect for closing out the day. I would totally recommend! Thank you, Terry and Jeanne :)

review_text: The Ogden View is in a 3 story vintage Victorian home in the heart of Escanaba's historic district and also steps from Escanaba's fabulous public lakefront and hike able nature peninsula, beach, lighthouse AND blocks from downtown! The bedroom is charming, bed comfortable, and the living room has two couches each that open up into extra beds. There is a full kitchen and the bathroom had a nice big bar of lavender soap for the tub/shower and good shampoo and conditioner. There were even locally sourced welcoming treats in the kitchen. We can't recommend this place enough!

name: Jamy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

August 2019
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Jeanne and Terry’s place (Ogden Manor) was lovely all around. The house is beautiful. Tasteful and detailed decor, historic charm, great artwork, and books. Lots of nice touches like a fully loaded picnic basket (blanket and plates, cups, utensils). Very comfortable living room, kitchen and bedroom. Gorgeous restored woodwork, etc, I could go on. The front porch is lovely to sit on day or night. Escanaba is about an hour and 20 min drive to both Pictured Rocks and Marquette. A great launching point with some good downtown restaurants and a brewery and wine tasting shop. Also the town has a 24 hour grocery store. Jeanne and Terry are good people with genuine hospitality. Stay here. I would do it again.

name: Brent
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2019
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Phenomenal! This is the best Airbnb we’ve stayed in and we always use Airbnb when traveling.
Ogden View Manor is a gorgeous historic house just a few blocks away from the Lake Michigan, restaurants and shopping. The house is split into a few units that are all accessed from the foyer. The private rear entrance adjoins your off street parking. If Jeanne hadn’t told us that there were other people staying in the house, we would have never known - we didn’t encountered anyone or hear any noise in the house at all during our three day stay. It was very private.
Our suite was spacious and felt much more like a high end bed and breakfast than the average Airbnb. Literally everything that we needed (and more) was all there from the fully equipped kitchen down to the organic handmade soap in the bathroom. The house is decorated with a mixture of lovely antiques and modern fixtures making it beyond comfortable. Great bed and an even better front porch complete with rocking chairs!
Jeanne is wonderful! She showed us around the place and made herself available as little or as much as we would like during our stay. She made great recommendations for restaurants and things to do in the area.
Stay here! It’s as simple as that. You will be glad you did. We will be returning to Ogden View Manor during our next trip to the UP.

review_text: Lisa’s apartment was very clean, comfortable, and convenient to town and local attractions. She was very responsive when we had some questions. We felt very comfortable here. Lisa has put a lot of thought into the amenities and decor! I am highly sensitive to scents/detergents so I especially appreciated no air fresheners and free & clear detergent being used. Comfy beds/linens, spotless bathroom, great shower, TV, well stocked kitchen. As mentioned, it is downtown across the street from a bar which was a little too lively for our liking Friday night but the noise from that was much better Saturday night. It was a holiday weekend so it’s understandable, but I would recommend bringing a white noise machine or fan to help block some of that out if staying during a weekend. Walkable to a handful of restaurants plus a chocolate shop/gift shop and the Swedish Pantry. We really enjoyed our time here!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: We LOVED our stay here. We stayed here for our honeymoon and this was our first Airbnb experience… it did not disappoint! My husband and I both despise hotels (due to lack of cleanliness, etc.,) and we will only rent Airbnb’s from now on! This place was SPOTLESS, I was SO impressed with how clean it was. Whoever does the cleaning truly does a wonderful job! We loved staying right downtown and we really enjoyed the cafe’s near by. Applewood Eatery & Espresso Bar is right downstairs (great food, great coffee) and across the street was Stone Cup Coffee House & Stone’s Deli (amazing coffee, the scones & bakery items are so good, and the food is amazing). Highly recommend checking out these two places. Only thing we could complain about was the noise of cars driving by, people revving their cars down the street, and drunk people walking home late at night from the bar next door. Being right downtown, the noise was expected though. I’m sure if you used a fan, it would help block it out!

The location was perfect for us, it was so easy to walk to nearby restaurants and bars, or just go for a stroll down the lovely street. Parking was easy for us and we never had a problem finding a spot to park on the side street. Also, we could look out the kitchen window and see our car anytime we wanted to check on it.
We loved the decor (it’s actually similar to some of the decor we have in our home!) and everything we needed was right there in the apartment.
It felt like our home away from home!

review_text:
The good: the unit is immaculate (clean and updated), the kitchen ware is adequate, the faucets water heats up fast, 4-5 minutes from Meijer/Walmart, good cell service.
the bad: outside the unit is less well kept including active spider webs(wife hates bugs with a passion), noticable road noise (although the street had much less traffic than I expected), it's less kid friendly than other options, 18" dishwasher with oversized plates/bowls
for us we'd probably rate it 3/5, but gave it a 4 because I figure not everyone will care about a few spiders in the corner of outside hallway and even though I didn't see the warning about it not being kid friendly, it does indeed give that warning. We made it work with a 4/2 year old, but another place may have been less worrisome.

We appreciated the functional space with a working kitchen and comfortable TV/living room. Beds were comfortable and individual air-conditioning allowed for personal temperature preferences.
Apartment is located up 21 stairs through a musty smelling staircase in an old downtown building with a bar across the street. The entry door did not lock which is a safety issue as downtown was pretty desolate at night.
Spotty WiFi.
Feel bad to say this, but is was a bit of disappointment.

review_text:
When we opened the door to the stairway which lead to the apartment, we were a little worried, but the second we opened the actual apartment door we were BLOWN AWAY! Lisa's place is incredible! I think I liked it more than my own home! It is beautifully decorated and had everything you could ever want or need. We didn't spend much time in the apartment because we were on the go during our 3 night stay, but if we wanted to stay home and cook instead of dining out, this would be the place. Appreciated having coffee and creamer in the fridge as I must have my caffeine first thing. Great bed/bedding, comfy sofa, nice tv, lovely bathroom and soaker tub. We had luxury at a bargain price! Better than any hotel!
Sidenote: If you want an authentic diner experience, head to Rosy's a couple doors down! Owner is a gem!
Another great spot to hit in Escanaba is the Upper Hand Brewery.

Lori's home was comfy and cozy. The kitchen was great for preparing food and she provided an excellent hot beverage bar with coffees, cappuccinos, and hot chocolate. There was a cute continental breakfast set up with fresh fruits and oatmeal too. Very thoughtful.
We absolutely loved the upstairs bedroom and the gorgeous updated bathroom. That walk in shower was great!
Everything was very clean. The dining room was perfect for enjoying our coffee and meals. Our first night we got in at dinner time so we grabed Pasties from Dobbers, but we also prepared foods on the nice stove as well. Lori has thought of everything when it comes to the kitchen and has all the basics for cooking stocked in the fridge and cabinets.
The living room area was comfy and the smart TV with all the go-to streaming apps available was a great addition.
Overall we loved our stay and would definitely book with Lori again.

The kitchen is fully stock and easy to navigate if you want to cook. There a muffins, fruits and juice waiting. She even provided board games for our kids. Everything is set up to make you feel at home. There is a binder of what to do and see in the area. Around the house are little notes to help you along the way. She gave us her number so she can be easily reach for any questions. Our stay could not have been smoother. Thank you for our 1st class stay!

Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The apartment above the coffee shop is great! It’s in such a good location in town and you’re able to walk to anywhere up and down the main st.
There are 3 windows facing the Main Street that allow you to lookout into the town of Escanaba. The light traffic and handful of people walking along the side walk gave me a sense of comfort and warmth. Occasionally, I would hear a distant and feint horn from a ship in the harbor. Another pleasant comfort.
The bathroom/shower is very nice and clean. Water pressure is great and gets hot!
Their was a cute welcome basket that contained some gourmet coffee made by the hosts. I enjoyed the Hunters Brew.
I had my two children visiting with me and they enjoyed the puzzles and games that were also in the home.
The couches are very comfortable and the lighting is cozy.
I would definitely stay again!

name: Jeff
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Julia did a great job in the description of her AirBnB. Then through the whole process, she was very responsive and did a great job in communicating and answering any questions that we have.
It is a great apartment in a great location. I think that you can tell from the photos and descriptions, but getting into the apartment could pose a problem if an individual had mobility issue. Steps up (both outside and inside) could be challenging for some.
Lights On and SUPER Clean made the entrance into the apartment AFTER dark a great start to our 3 night trip. THANKS!!

We WILL stay here again!

review_text: We really enjoyed our stay in Escanaba. What a cute town! Julia had the place spotless for us, and the kitchen had everything we needed to prepare some simple meals. I love the smell of coffee roasting, so being above the roasting shop was fantastic for us! They left us a sample of their coffee, and it’s super yummy. The Escanaba magazine was a nice touch, too. It was a great jumping off point for us to explore the UP the next day (Pictured Rocks in Munising and dinner in Marquette).

,

,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: The apartment was clean and comfortable, particularly the beds and pillows. The kitchen is well-appointed with dishes, silverware, paper towels, and cleaning products. The living room is spacious, with large windows and two large sofas. The bathroom is good-sized, with retro black-and-white floor tile. Body wash, shampoo, conditioner, and hand soap are all provided. The stacked washer and dryer was a nice convenience, with even a couple of laundry pods thrown in. Finally, parking in the rear of the unit was easy. Don't be deterred by the wooden steps. They are well-built and rock solid. If you love coffee, you'll love the smell that permeates the unit.
